task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 264°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need the full façade/roofline of the west-facing main building, so I should tilt up to capture its top for height estimation.
The view is now facing north instead of west, so I should rotate left to 270° to re-acquire the target building while keeping the upward pitch to see its roofline.
To estimate height I need to see both the base and roof of the west-facing main building, so I should tilt up while staying aimed west.
The heading has snapped back to north again, so I must rotate left to 270° to face the target building while keeping the upward pitch for roof visibility.
Since pitch keeps resetting, I'll estimate height from this level view by using visible floors/windows and typical story height.
